crimeSpy.crimeData

Class CrimeRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • crimeSpy.crimeData.CrimeRecord

  • public class CrimeRecord
extends java.lang.Object
    Define the crime record object. (this currently describes a crime incident as recorded for general public consumption by CLEAR Dependant on:
    • CrimeLocation - object describes the location of the crime with various properties
    • CrimeType - object describes the type of the crime with various properties

    • Constructor Detail

      • CrimeRecord

        public CrimeRecord()
        Constructor for empty CrimeRecord

      • CrimeRecord

        public CrimeRecord(java.lang.String caseID,
                   org.joda.time.DateTime date,
                   java.lang.Boolean arrest,
                   java.lang.Boolean domestic,
                   java.lang.String iucr,
                   java.lang.String fbiCD,
                   java.lang.String block,
                   java.lang.Integer beat,
                   java.lang.Integer ward,
                   double xCoord,
                   double yCoord,
                   double latitude,
                   double longitude,
                   java.lang.String location)
        Constructor for full CrimeRecord

        Notes

        • location the location string description is separate and distinct to the location tuple consisting of {latitude, longitude}. It is instead purely a textual description of the location of the crime. eg: "DEPARTMENT STORE"
        • Location data is stored in a CrimeLocation object and includes (block, beat, ward, x/y co-ord, lat, long, locStr)
        • Crime type data is stored in a CrimeType object and includes (iucr, fbiCD, pri/sec descrip.)

        Parameters:
        caseID - the unique caseID for the crime. (Alphanumeric)
        date - The date the crime was committed. (This is currently stored as JodaTime)
        arrest - True/False - was there an arrest?
        domestic - True/False - was this a domestic crime
        iucr - Illinois Uniform Crime Reporting code (see also here)
        fbiCD - FBI crime code. (Numerical/Alphanumerical)
        block - Address of crime at city block level (zip code and street; last two digits of zip code are anonymised)
        beat - Police district (geographic area of the city broken down for patrol and stats reasons)
        ward - Election precincts (see also here)
        xCoord - map coordinate
        yCoord - map coordinate
        latitude - Latitude of location of crime
        longitude - Longitude of location of crime
        location - string location description

      • validateFbiCd

        public boolean validateFbiCd(java.lang.String fbicdStr)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Check the validity of the FBI CD code for the crime record.

        An FBI CD code should be alphanumeric, not null and not empty. Additionally this code assumes that the code should be at least 3 characters in length.

        Parameters:
        fbicdStr - intended icur code
        Returns:
        true iff the string matches the pattern of a valid icur code. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the FBI CD number is not valid

      • MillisBetween

        public org.joda.time.Period MillisBetween(CrimeRecord other)
        Gets a time period between two CrimeRecords and returns it as a period of years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes, seconds and millis.
        Parameters:
        other - the CrimeRecord being compared to the CrimeRecord the method is being called on
        Returns:
        period of years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes, seconds and millis representing the time between the CrimeRecords being compared

      • distanceBetween

        public double distanceBetween(CrimeRecord other)
        Uses the haversine formula to calculate the distance between two CrimeRecords, taking into account the curvature of the earth (as sphere rather than an oblate spheroid, because we're filthy math casuals.
        Parameters:
        other - The CrimeRecord that the distance is measured to.
        Returns:
        The distance in kilometers
